column4: does anybody know how to change default window manager in 10.04? nothing seems to work! gconf'ing required_components/windowmanager is not being honored, metacity gets loaded even before user logs in... it's a nightmare
Welcome to ubuntu!
very quaint
I'm completely serious.
guess you're serious about welcoming me... thanks! but i interpreted your response as "ubuntu doesn't allow changing WM"
Feel welcomed, but I was actually referring to the latter
It's an insane process, I hated it when I were running ubuntu
yeah... insane it is.
Don
Dont want to recommend it to someone new, but you _could_ purge metacity completely
And hurl in something good, like awesome
unfortunately it's not possible to get rid of metacity, since gdm obviously depends on it for decoration, all i'm trying to do is to run my preferred StumpWM...
Hurl gnome+everything into the bin, run your WM without a DE and run SLIM as log-in manager if you want that :)
But if you choose to do so; why are you running ubuntu? :)
i do like gnome for dbus stuff
Explain why?
Are you still here? :)
yeah, still here
dbus is needed for an app i'm working on
plus it's the only indirect way to communicate with bluetooth devices
Well, then I understand :)
i had a choice, to either use blueZ directly from within my app or to use dbus, i chose the latter
